name: Congenital Jejunal Atresia with Apple-Peel Deformity
chief_complaint: My newborn hasn't passed stool and is vomiting green fluid

lab_results.Abdominal X-ray: Double bubble sign with distal gaslessness

prognosis: Good with prompt surgical intervention, but risk of short bowel syndrome if extensive resection required
description: A rare form of intestinal atresia where the proximal jejunum ends blindly with the distal bowel coiled around a vascular remnant resembling an apple peel. Caused by intrauterine vascular compromise of the superior mesenteric artery.
multiple_choice: Congenital Jejunal Atresia with Apple-Peel Deformity
